section.title: Error Messages
section.para: Drools 5 introduces standardized error messages. This standardization aims to help users to find and resolve problems in a easier and faster way. In this section you will learn how to identify and interpret those error messages, and you will also receive some tips on how to solve the problems associated with them.

section.title: Message format
section.para: The standardization includes the error message format and to better explain this format, let's use the following example:
1st Block: This area identifies the error code.
2nd Block: Line and column information.
3rd Block: Some text describing the problem.
4th Block: This is the first context. Usually indicates the rule, function, template or query where the error occurred. This block is not mandatory.
5th Block: Identifies the pattern where the error occurred. This block is not mandatory.

section.title: 101: No viable alternative
section.para: Indicates the most common errors, where the parser came to a decision point but couldn't identify an alternative. Here are some examples:

example.programlisting: 1: rule one 2: when 3: exists Foo() 4: exits Bar() 5: then 6: end

section.para: The above example generates this message:

listitem.para: [ERR 101] Line 4:4 no viable alternative at input 'exits' in rule one

section.para: At first glance this seems to be valid syntax, but it is not (exits != exists). Let's take a look at next example:

example.programlisting: 1: package org.drools; 2: rule 3: when 4: Object() 5: then 6: System.out.println("A RHS"); 7: end

section.para: Now the above code generates this message:

listitem.para: [ERR 101] Line 3:2 no viable alternative at input 'WHEN'

section.para: This message means that the parser encountered the token WHEN, actually a hard keyword, but it's in the wrong place since the the rule name is missing.
The error "no viable alternative" also occurs when you make a simple lexical mistake. Here is a sample of a lexical problem:

example.programlisting: 1: rule simple_rule 2: when 3: Student( name == "Andy ) 4: then 5: end

section.para: The above code misses to close the quotes and because of this the parser generates this error message:

listitem.para: [ERR 101] Line 0:-1 no viable alternative at input '<eof>' in rule simple_rule in pattern Student

tip.para: Usually the Line and Column information are accurate, but in some cases (like unclosed quotes), the parser generates a 0:-1 position. In this case you should check whether you didn't forget to close quotes, apostrophes or parentheses.

section.title: 102: Mismatched input
section.para: This error indicates that the parser was looking for a particular symbol that it didn’t ﬁnd at the current input position. Here are some samples:
The above example generates this message:

listitem.para: [ERR 102] Line 0:-1 mismatched input '<eof>' expecting ')' in rule simple_rule in pattern Bar

section.para: To fix this problem, it is necessary to complete the rule statement.

tip.para: Usually when you get a 0:-1 position, it means that parser reached the end of source.

section.para: The following code generates more than one error message:

example.programlisting: 1: package org.drools; 2: 3: rule "Avoid NPE on wrong syntax" 4: when 5: not( Cheese( ( type == "stilton", price == 10 ) || ( type == "brie", price == 15 ) ) from $cheeseList ) 6: then 7: System.out.println("OK"); 8: end

section.para: These are the errors associated with this source:

listitem.para: [ERR 102] Line 5:36 mismatched input ',' expecting ')' in rule "Avoid NPE on wrong syntax" in pattern Cheese
[ERR 101] Line 5:57 no viable alternative at input 'type' in rule "Avoid NPE on wrong syntax"
[ERR 102] Line 5:106 mismatched input ')' expecting 'then' in rule "Avoid NPE on wrong syntax"

section.para: Note that the second problem is related to the first. To fix it, just replace the commas (",") by AND operator ("&&").

tip.para: In some situations you can get more than one error message. Try to fix one by one, starting at the first one. Some error messages are generated merely as consequences of other errors.

section.title: 103: Failed predicate
section.para: A validating semantic predicate evaluated to false. Usually these semantic predicates are used to identify soft keywords. This sample shows exactly this situation:

example.programlisting: 1: package nesting; 2: dialect "mvel" 3: 4: import org.drools.Person 5: import org.drools.Address 6: 7: fdsfdsfds 8: 9: rule "test something" 10: when 11: p: Person( name=="Michael" ) 12: then 13: p.name = "other"; 14: System.out.println(p.name); 15: end

section.para: With this sample, we get this error message:

listitem.para: [ERR 103] Line 7:0 rule 'rule_key' failed predicate: {(validateIdentifierKey(DroolsSoftKeywords.RULE))}? in rule

section.para: The fdsfdsfds text is invalid and the parser couldn’t identify it as the soft keyword "rule".

tip.para: This error is very similar to 102: Mismatched input, but usually involves soft keywords.

section.title: 104: Trailing semi-colon not allowed
section.para: This error is associated with the "eval" clause, where its expression may not be terminated with a semicolon. Check this example:

example.programlisting: 1: rule simple_rule 2: when 3: eval(abc();) 4: then 5: end

section.para: Due to the trailing semicolon within eval, we get this error message:

listitem.para: [ERR 104] Line 3:4 trailing semi-colon not allowed in rule simple_rule

section.para: This problem is simple to fix: just remove the semi-colon.

section.title: 105: Early Exit
section.para: The recognizer came to a subrule in the grammar that must match an alternative at least once, but the subrule did not match anything. Simply put: the parser has entered a branch from where there is no way out. This example illustrates it:
This is the message associated to the above sample:

listitem.para: [ERR 105] Line 2:2 required (...)+ loop did not match anything at input 'aa' in template test_error

section.para: To fix this problem it is necessary to remove the numeric value as it is neither a valid data type which might begin a new template slot nor a possible start for any other rule file construct.

section.title: Other Messages
section.para: Any other message means that something bad has happened, so please contact the development team.
